intro: Rubus hirtus var. ovatus, commonly known as the rough raspberry or ovate raspberry, is a deciduous shrub belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with ovate leaflets. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, which are typically red or yellow when ripe. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
